about.help: Literature Search and Pathway Discovery was retrieved from Youtube from the channel J. Christopher Anderson, and was created on 8/30/2013.

contents.params: How to find information in the biological literature and design pathways
The journals related to biology and what they are good for.

Biochemical information exists at multiple levels of granularity.  In coarse form, data about proteins and RNAs exists in various public databases on the internet.  However, most of the info you want will require that you read papers.

Let's say you want to make a chemical in E. coli or yeast.  The first question to ask is whether you know of any enzymatic pathway from a native metabolite to the product of interest. This is the pathway identification problem.
